confession.devil_appearance: appeared as black dog in her garden
confession.seduction_context: Was angry that her husband called her witch, so took her distaff to go to 'escraignes'; he appeared when she was on way, remarked she was very angry, then threw her against 'fumier' and wanted to have intercourse. Initially said she was unwilling and saw another woman coming with a lantern, but under pressure admitted intercourse took place, and he disappeared when woman with lantern approached
sabbat_activities: claimed to have been only once, and only other person there with her master was a woman she did not know

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Preliminary investigations began. Had been accused by Bastien Cousturier of la Neufville, who had applied to PG

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Rémy asks for arrest and interrogation

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Said she had been seduced by Mre Persin around previous Christmas

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - given thumbscrews, rack, tortillons, and strappado with weights attached to feet, but continued denials

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Confessed to causing illness of Languillon, deaths of horses, death of second wife of Bastien des Preys, and death of Parisot's daughter. Said attended sabbat once

timeline.subject: Isabillon femme Jean Parmentier
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

methods: strappado with weights attached to feet

accomplices_named.name: unknown woman
accomplices_named.context: claimed to have been at sabbat once, and only other person there with her master was a woman she did not know

prior_accusations.context: Remembered that she had hidden her goods when information was taken against la Grosse Janotte from house of George Masson, who was not convicted

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Jean Braconnier (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: je croy que cest sorciere me veult faire mourir
notable_quotes.english: I believe that this witch wants to make me die
notable_quotes.context: Her husband (father of witness) found a spider in his plate

notable_quotes.speaker: Jannotte veuve Demenge Bagard (witness 5)
notable_quotes.french: ladite Ysabilon se mesle ordinairement de penser, visiter, et guerir les malades et quand elle en scait quelqu'un elle y va pour estre appellée
notable_quotes.english: The said Ysabillon ordinarily meddles with caring for, visiting, and healing the sick, and when she knows of someone ill she goes there to be called
notable_quotes.context: Describing Isabillon's role as folk healer

notable_quotes.speaker: Magdellaine femme Didier Languille (witness 13)
notable_quotes.french: de telle sorte qu'elle a procuré leur ruine totalle
notable_quotes.english: in such a way that she procured their total ruin
notable_quotes.context: After refusal to renew lease of garden

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Thomassin (witness 27) reporting Isabillon's words to his daughter
notable_quotes.english: he would take care of it/he would beware
notable_quotes.context: Threat after he took caution against her for payment

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengin Millecy (witness 28) reporting Isabillon
notable_quotes.french: le respect qu'il porte a ses enfants
notable_quotes.english: the respect that he bears for his children
notable_quotes.context: Said that but for this she would have killed herself

harms_catalog.victim_name: husband of Anne femme Mre George Bertrand (Mre George Bertrand)
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly lost use of limbs and needed crutches, was in bed for 17 days
harms_catalog.method_alleged: presence and prediction - she said he would recover, and he did so in a few days

harms_catalog.harm_description: died suddenly in their stable
recent death
death of cow

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill immediately after eating bread, died a week later with great pain in limbs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he had not wanted to hire her stepdaughter as servant again
harms_catalog.method_alleged: offered piece of bread to his daughter; when she was in house the victim felt great pain in her limbs, which decreased once she left

harms_catalog.harm_description: death of ox
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he had forbidden her his house
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after he had forbidden her his house

harms_catalog.harm_description: had thigh broken in accident when digging a cellar

was ill and in danger of death; recovered in 2 days after she said he would recover
harms_catalog.method_alleged: asked after him, then said he would recover

harms_catalog.harm_description: had been in bed for 17 days, started to recover 4 days after she said he would get better
7 of them became ill, husband had to go on pilgrimage to seek healing; took a year to recover

harms_catalog.harm_description: loss of 5 horses in year; were unable to continue ploughing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refusal to renew lease of garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill with 'ung poinct'; during treatment by Isabillon, pain ceased when she said prayer, only to resume once she left
harms_catalog.method_alleged: treated her during illness, saying a prayer; pain ceased during treatment, resumed once she left

harms_catalog.victim_name: small brother-in-law of Bastien des Preys
harms_catalog.harm_description: recovered from illness after she said he would
harms_catalog.method_alleged: said he would recover from illness, which he did

harms_catalog.victim_name: Jeanne, second wife of Bastien des Preys
harms_catalog.harm_description: taken with severe illness 2 weeks after quarrels; thought possessed; said devil was preventing her saying paternoster; died in 2 weeks
harms_catalog.method_alleged: During illness Ysabillon asked him how she did, and said she would recover, added that he should not suspect anyone

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Mengeatte femme Jean Parisat
harms_catalog.harm_description: death after eating bread given by Isabillon

harms_catalog.victim_name: 9 horses and cattle of Parisat household
harms_catalog.harm_description: deaths of 9 horses and cattle
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: although they had not quarrelled with her

harms_catalog.harm_description: deaths of various animals
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: after he beat her daughter, who was servant in his house

hearsay_chains.content: she had told neighbours that Isabillon was cause of her illness
Did recover her senses before death, but said nothing to him about accused being cause; she had however told neighbours this
had often heard her called witch, notably by her husband (father of witness)

emotional_state_notes: angry that her husband called her witch

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Denied causing death of Jean Parisot's daughter, saying the girl was already sick

Had never spoken to Didier Languille, who was 'un gueux et un meschant homme', about his son, who was 'l'un des plus meschant guerson' of la Neufville. As for his dead horses, he had small horses which he worked too hard

Said that she had visited Catherine, first wife of Bastien des Preys, during her illness. She had injured her stomach in a fall on way to mill at Jarville; if she were alive would not accuse her as others did. Agreed she had quarrelled with his second wife Jeanne, but it had not been serious, she did not hate her, and had neither caused nor wished her any harm

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 29 witnesses. Isabillon was clearly a folk healer who was called to treat the sick. Pattern of quarrels over economic matters (garden lease, servant employment, debts for straw and peas) followed by harms. Resisted torture initially (thumbscrews, rack, tortillons, strappado with weights) but eventually confessed after subsequent interrogation with threats. Notable that she provided natural explanations for alleged harms (girl already sick, Catherine injured in fall, Languille worked his horses too hard). Case shows healing activities being reinterpreted as witchcraft. Multiple witnesses testified to long-standing reputation (7+ years). Death sentence from Change de Nancy on June 23, 1599.
